column4: How do I restrict one of my ubuntu user from accessing Internet?
MAC filter
Thanks for reply, how to use MAC filter?
On the router / AP, use MAC filtering.
WHat kind of router do you use?
I am using an ZTE Modem.
I don't know about ZTE modem, refer to manual.
Is thier something that we can do that does't involves Modem?
We would need to know more about your LAN.
On the server itself?  What exactly do you need to do?  Restirct it from all traffic?
I don't have a LAN connection, I want to Restrict one of my user from accessing Internet?
THat  will need to done on the router / modem.
I am assuming the modem is also a router?  Or do you have a separate router?
No, I have only a single Modem.
and that modem also acts as router for the LAN?
You need to give a detailed discription of your LAN.
If you can ssh into the PC in question, you could do it there....
ok
If you ssh into the machine in question and add ifdown eth0 to /etc/rc.local and then issucommand eth0 down that would block  it from network connection, (if eth0 is the NIC that is connected).
Where do I specify which user to block from accessing Internet connection?
Oh you are talking about a user on the same machine? If so;  mezquitale has a good possible solution.
